oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ENVIRONMENTALLY-ASSISTED CRACKING OF ENGINEERING MATERIALS - AN INSIGHT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KANNAN, MB
RAJA, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: stress-corrosion cracking
austenitic stainless-steels
mg-al alloy
cu-zr alloy
hydrogen embrittlement
magnesium alloys
intergranular corrosion
aluminum-alloy
phase-transformations
localized corrosion
environmentally-assisted cracking
austenitic stainless steels
aluminium alloys
magnesium alloys
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper reviews the environmentally-assisted cracking studies of some of the key engineering materials i.e. austenitic stainless steels, aluminium alloys and magnesium alloys. Some of the salient work carried out by the research laboratories and institutions in India and other countries, in this critical research area, are brought out in this paper.
